Author: jspook16#3059
Content:
i think i need some help. I've got bdex running on a remote machine and another bdex on a local. My order that i place on the remote do not show up on the local but the orders i place on the local show up in the remote. Im looking at both instances on the local machine (remote bdex via ssh tunnel)
its almost like my orders on the remote are not being broadcast
but the advisories indicate my order is being placed

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: and both instances are 1.1.1-rc

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: use different passphrases on different nodes

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: I do have a unique passphrase for each instance.

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: on the remote bdex, the remote order dont show on their either...but My Offers tab shows that they were placed

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: Figured it out. The "myipaddress" file in .Barterdex directory was empty for some reason. Put my ip in there manually, lanuched it and started giving all kinds of errors. I deleted the file and let bdex create it on the next launch and the ip was filled in and my orders are showing up now.

Author: jspook16#3059
Content: I wonder if that means that if I take my "laptop" and connect to a different network, if this file gets updated automatically. I'll test when I get a chance

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: @adrian.marinescu please don't private message asking general support questions.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I'll not answer general queries in private messages.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: you can change the p2p port of any assetchain just by changing the p2p port in config file

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: it should work just fine

Author: adrian.marinescu#0328
Content: @grewalsatinder I am sorry, I didn't know

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: no worries

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: an assetchain sets it's port fixed

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: it is not a dynamic p2p port

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: if you use same assetchain params, you should always get the same p2p and rpc port

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: unless you changed the name of the assetchain or supply or any other param etc

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Re: `support here isnt as great as advertised`
In my experience the support and patience shown by everyone here has been very amazing!
There are times when I didn't understand the answers and when I couldn't get things working, but that was a function of my own lack of basic knowledge (I'm starting from 0).
By investing time in research and building of experience I've moved past those difficulties and move on to newer ones while gaining a bit more of an understanding.
Very grateful to you guys for all the help!

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
And now another question ;)
Is there a way send funds from an `address` rather than `account` for t-transactions?  Like `z_sendmany "fromaddress" [{"address":... ,"amount":...},...] ( minconf ) ( fee )` but from a t-address.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: (or maybe something coming with `== Addressindex ==`??)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: use z_sendmany!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: "fromaddress" can be a t address

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Haha, I must have messed something up before (on STAKED3).  I'll check it and give it another shot on STAKED4.  Thanks!

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Oh, I remember now... the error message said something about it not being a privacy chain.

Author: Bitcoiner#5383
Content: Hey guys     port7771 is already taken  ?  What does it mean, how can i solve this problem ?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: It means that komodod is already running in the background

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: check on the task manager to see if komodod is still running

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: @Bitcoiner  if it's still running you will need to shut it down , if it's CLI you will need to do the command ./komodo-cli stop in your terminal

Author: Bitcoiner#5383
Content: Thank you hermes  i try it

Author: Sharifa#7849
Content:
@Hermes hi .. sorry noob here... is this a new release for
App Agama Wallet for android?

link : https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/agama-mobile/releases/download/v0.0.7/agama-mobile-v0.0.7.apk

If so, do i have to uninstall 0.1.0 and install new version 0.0.7?
Can i use PIN on new version?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: 0.0.7 is older than 0.1.0

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: I always erase the last version when I install but if I recall correctly you should be able to use the same pin , but also because of it being a testing wallet make sure to have your seed written down correctly and confirm that you have access to your funds by entering the wallet with it only at least 2 times.

Author: pbca26#5430
Content:
uninstall is not necessary
0.0.7 and 0.1.0 are backward compatible

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
uninstalling 41-beta on ubuntu on one of my laptops.

I installed it awhile ago, and I did it wrong back then.

I installed everything in the /usr/src/ directory, but I think I should have installed it in /opt/

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: How do I properly uninstall? I don't see a ./uninstall option in here.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: You installed it on /usr/src ? Or do you mean that you were using the portable version and located the file in that directory?

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
On this laptop, I put it in /usr/src/ and then installed it within that folder.

I don't have anything on this laptop in the /opt/ folder, which is where I think we're supposed to install it.

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: should I just delete the folder, and save the wallet.dat file? Or is there more to be done?

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: ^ the agama folder

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: If you don't have a pin saved for lite mode in that folder , you can erase the program but the setup should have detected any previous version and let you uninstall as normal,  in regards to the wallet.dat file that's located in the Komodo folder not Agamas folder so it wont affect it

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
I'm not using lite mode here, so it should be okay...

What do you mean, 'uninstall as normal'?

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: Should I just download the new version and install it into the correct location? Will it automatically unistall the existing installation?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: yes with the setup it should overwrite in the previous version without having to erase the folder

Content: I removed the folder, downloaded the .tar.gz file, extracted it, moved it into /usr/src, and the tried executing `./AgamaApp...`, but I get an error saying "No such file or directory"

Content: What am I missing?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: are you in the correct path ?
